content:
Diagnosis:

Limited stage small cell lung cancer, right lung
Initial diagnosis March 2024
MYCN amplification detected

Previous treatment:
Cisplatin/Etoposide commenced 15 March 2024
Concurrent thoracic radiotherapy completed 12 April 2024

Previous medical history:
Type 2 diabetes
Hypertension

Current medications:
Metformin 1g BD
Ramipril 5mg OD
Ondansetron 8mg PRN

Current situation:
Progressive disease following cycle 3 chemotherapy

CT thorax 10 May 2024 shows enlarging right hilar mass (8.2cm from 6.5cm) with new right pleural effusion

I reviewed [redacted name] today who has unfortunately shown disease progression on current first-line treatment. He reports worsening breathlessness over the past 2 weeks and new onset right-sided chest pain requiring regular breakthrough analgesia. His appetite has significantly declined with 4kg weight loss since last review. Examination shows reduced air entry at the right base with dullness to percussion, consistent with the pleural effusion seen on imaging.

Given the clear evidence of disease progression, we have discussed changing treatment to second-line topotecan. I have explained the aims, schedule and potential side effects of this treatment. We will arrange pleural aspiration next week prior to starting the new treatment. I have also referred to palliative care for additional support with symptom management.

The plan is to commence weekly topotecan next Thursday, with clinical review after cycle 1. I have provided emergency contact numbers and written information about the new treatment regimen.
